Use mode='code' (default) for API references and code examples, or mode='info' for conceptual guides, narrative information, and architectural questions.","parameters":"{\"context7CompatibleLibraryID\": \"/llmstxt/cursor_llms_txt\", \"topic\": \"API key base URL override settings configuration\", \"mode\": \"code\"}","serverName":"Context7"}]}
toolFormerData.result: {"selectedTool":"get-library-docs","result":"{\"content\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"### Configuring API Keys in Cursor\\n\\nSource: https://context7_llms\\n\\nUse your own LLM provider by configuring API keys within Cursor's settings.\\n\\n```en\\nUse your own LLM provider\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### API Key Configuration and Usage\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/ko/settings/api-keys\\n\\nInstructions for setting up and using custom API keys in Cursor. This involves navigating to Cursor Settings, entering the API key, and verifying it. It also outlines which LLM providers and models are supported and notes limitations regarding special models.\\n\\n```APIDOC\\nCursor Settings:\\n  Navigate to > Models\\n  Enter API Key\\n  Click Verify\\n\\nSupported Providers:\\n  OpenAI: Standard GPT models only. Inference models (o1, o1-mini, o3-mini) are not supported.\\n  Anthropic: All Claude models available via Anthropic API.\\n  Google: Gemini models available via Google AI API.\\n  Azure OpenAI: Models deployed to Azure OpenAI Service instances.\\n  AWS Bedrock: Works with available models in Bedrock configuration using AWS access key, secret key, or IAM role.\\n\\nLimitations:\\n  Custom API keys work with standard chat models only.\\n  Features requiring specialized models (e.g., Tab Completion) continue to use Cursor's built-in models.\\n\\nData Handling:\\n  API keys are not stored locally.\\n  Keys are sent with every request through Cursor's backend for prompt finalization.\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### API Key Configuration and Usage\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/en/settings/api-keys\\n\\nThis section details how to configure and use your own API keys for various LLM providers within Cursor. It outlines the process of entering keys in Cursor Settings, verification, and the limitations of custom API keys.\\n\\n```APIDOC\\nCursor Settings > Models\\n  - Enter your API keys here.\\n  - Click **Verify** to validate.\\n\\nLimitations:\\n  - Custom API keys only work with standard chat models.\\n  - Features requiring specialized models (e.g., Tab Completion) use Cursor's built-in models.\\n\\nSupported Providers:\\n  - OpenAI: Standard GPT models only (Reasoning models o1, o1-mini, o3-mini not supported).\\n  - Anthropic: All Claude models via Anthropic API.\\n  - Google: Gemini models via Google AI API.\\n  - Azure OpenAI: Models deployed in Azure OpenAI Service.\\n  - AWS Bedrock: Use AWS access keys, secret keys, or IAM roles with configured models.\\n\\nAWS Bedrock Specifics:\\n  - A unique external ID is generated after validating your Bedrock IAM role.\\n  - This ID can be added to your IAM role trust policy for enhanced security.\\n\\nFAQ - API Key Storage:\\n  - Your API key is not stored locally.\\n  - It is sent to the Cursor server with every request for prompt building.\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### Authenticate with API Key using Authorization Header\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/zh-Hant/account/teams/admin-api\\n\\nShows how to authenticate API requests by setting the Authorization header with a base64 encoded API key.\\n\\n```bash\\nAuthorization: Basic {base64_encode('API_KEY:')}\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### Team Settings Configuration\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/id/account/teams/dashboard\\n\\nConfigure team preferences and security settings, including data sharing, billing limits, IAM roles, SSO, API keys, active sessions, and invite codes.\\n\\n```APIDOC\\nTeam Settings:\\n  Privacy Settings:\\n    - Control data sharing preferences.\\n    - Configure zero data retention policies with AI providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex AI, xAi Grok).\\n    - Manage privacy enforcement across the team.\\n  Usage-Based Billing Settings:\\n    - Enable usage-based billing and set spending limits.\\n    - Configure monthly team spending limits and optional per-user limits.\\n    - Control if only admins can change these settings.\\n  Bedrock IAM Roles:\\n    - Configure AWS Bedrock IAM roles for secure cloud integration.\\n  Single Sign-On (SSO):\\n    - Set up SSO authentication for enterprise teams.\\n  Admin API Keys:\\n    - Create and manage API keys for programmatic access to admin features.\\n  Active Sessions:\\n    - Monitor and manage active user sessions across the team.\\n  Invite Code Management:\\n    - Create and manage invite codes for new team members.\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### Authenticate with API Key using Authorization Header\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/zh/account/teams/admin-api\\n\\nShows how to authenticate API requests by setting the Authorization header with a base64 encoded API key. This is an alternative to Basic Authentication.\\n\\n```bash\\nAuthorization: Basic {base64_encode('API_KEY:')}\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### API de Administraci├│n: Autenticaci├│n y URL Base\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/es/account/teams/admin-api\\n\\nDetalla los m├⌐todos de autenticaci├│n para la API de Administraci├│n, incluyendo el uso de claves de API con autenticaci├│n b├ísica o encabezados Authorization. Tambi├⌐n especifica la URL base para todos los endpoints de la API.\\n\\n```APIDOC\\nURL Base:\\n  https://api.cursor.com\\n\\nAutenticaci├│n:\\n  Usar clave de API como nombre de usuario en autenticaci├│n b├ísica.\\n  Formato de clave: `key_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`\\n\\n  Ejemplo con curl:\\n  curl https://api.cursor.com/{route} -u API_KEY:\\n\\n  Ejemplo con encabezado Authorization:\\n  Authorization: Basic {base64_encode('API_KEY:')}\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### API de Administra├º├úo - Autentica├º├úo e URL Base\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/pt-BR/account/teams/admin-api\\n\\nDetalha os m├⌐todos de autentica├º├úo e a URL base para interagir com a API de Administra├º├úo do Cursor. Inclui exemplos de uso com curl para autentica├º├úo b├ísica e a defini├º├úo do cabe├ºalho Authorization.\\n\\n```APIDOC\\nAutentica├º├úo:\\nTodas as requisi├º├╡es da API requerem autentica├º├úo usando uma chave de API.\\nFormato da Chave: `key_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`\\n\\nUsando a Chave de API:\\nUse sua chave de API como nome de usu├írio na autentica├º├úo b├ísica.\\n\\nUsando curl com autentica├º├úo b├ísica:\\n```bash\\ncurl https://api.cursor.com/{route} -u API_KEY:\\n```\\n\\nOu defina o cabe├ºalho Authorization diretamente:\\n```bash\\nAuthorization: Basic {base64_encode('API_KEY:')}\\n```\\n\\nURL Base:\\nTodos os endpoints da API usam:\\n```\\nhttps://api.cursor.com\\n```\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### Using Your Own LLM Provider with API Keys in Cursor\\n\\nSource: https://context7_llms\\n\\nConfigure Cursor to use your preferred LLM provider by setting up your API keys.\\n\\n```en\\nAPI Keys: https://docs.cursor.com/fr/settings/api-keys.md\\n```\\n\\n--------------------------------\\n\\n### Overriding Channel Settings\\n\\nSource: https://docs.cursor.com/zh-Hant/slack\\n\\nDemonstrates how explicit options can override channel-specific default settings, such as specifying a repository directly in the command.\\n\\n```Slack\\n@Cursor [repo=...] [prompt]\\n```\"}]}"}

data.text:
Based on my analysis of your local NTFS configuration, here's what I found:

---

## System Overview

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **OS** | Windows 11 Pro Build **26200** |
| **Disk** | Samsung MZVL21T0HDLU-00BL7 (NVMe SSD) |
| **Total Size** | 953.87 GB |
| **Partition Style** | GPT |
| **Health Status** | Healthy |

---

## Partition Layout

| # | Type | Size | Drive | Notes |
|---|------|------|-------|-------|
| 1 | EFI System | 100 MB | - | Standard UEFI boot |
| 2 | MSR (Reserved) | 16 MB | - | Microsoft Reserved |
| 3 | Basic (NTFS) | **953.04 GB** | C: | Main volume |
| 4 | Recovery | **718 MB** | - | Windows Recovery |

---

## Notable Observations

### Nothing Unusual Found - Standard Configuration

| Setting | Value | Status |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Cluster Size** | 4 KB (4096 bytes) | Default/Normal |
| **Compression** | Disabled | Normal |
| **Indexing** | Enabled | Normal |
| **TRIM** | Enabled | Correct for SSD |
| **8.3 Names** | Per-volume (default) | Normal |
| **Paging File Encryption** | Disabled | Normal |
| **MFT Zone** | 200 MB (minimum) | Normal |
| **Unallocated Space** | ~1 MB | Fully partitioned |

### One Observation Worth Noting

**Recovery Partition Size: 718 MB** - This is on the **smaller side** for Windows 11. Microsoft recommends at least 990 MB for Windows 11 recovery partitions to accommodate future updates. Some cumulative updates may fail to install recovery environment updates if this partition is too small. You may eventually see Event ID 1 errors from `Microsoft-Windows-WinRE-RecoveryAgent` if updates can't fit.

---

## Summary

Your NTFS configuration is **standard and healthy**. The only potential concern is the slightly undersized recovery partition (718 MB vs. recommended 990 MB+), which could cause issues with future Windows Recovery Environment updates but doesn't affect normal NTFS operation.

{"tools":[{"name":"microsoft_docs_fetch","description":"Fetch and convert a Microsoft Learn documentation page to markdown format. This tool retrieves the latest complete content of Microsoft documentation pages including Azure, .NET, Microsoft 365, and other Microsoft technologies.

## When to Use This Tool
- When search results provide incomplete information or truncated content
- When you need complete step-by-step procedures or tutorials
- When you need troubleshooting sections, prerequisites, or detailed explanations
- When search results reference a specific page that seems highly relevant
- For comprehensive guides that require full context

## Usage Pattern
Use this tool AFTER microsoft_docs_search when you identify specific high-value pages that need complete content. The search tool gives you an overview; this tool gives you the complete picture.

## URL Requirements
- The URL must be a valid link from the microsoft.com domain.

## Output Format
markdown with headings, code blocks, tables, and links preserved.","parameters":"{"url": "https://support.microsoft.com/help/5028997"}","serverName":"MS_Learn_Docs"}]}
toolFormerData.result: {"selectedTool":"microsoft_docs_fetch","result":"{\"content\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"# KB5028997: Instructions to manually resize your partition to install the WinRE update\\r\\n\\r\\nApplies To\\r\\n\\r\\nWindows 10Windows 10, version 1607, all editionsWindows Server 2016, all editionsWin 10 Ent LTSC 2019Win 10 IoT Ent LTSC 2019Windows 10 IoT Core LTSCWindows Server 2019Windows 10 Enterprise and Education, version 21H2Windows 10 IoT Enterprise, version 21H2Windows 10 Enterprise Multi-Session, version 21H2Windows 10, version 22H2, all editionsWindows 11 version 21H2, all editionsWindows 11 version 22H2, all editionsWindows 11 version 23H2, all editions\\r\\n\\r\\n## Summary\\r\\n\\r\\nMicrosoft has changed how it updates PCs that run the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE). WinRE will be updated using the monthly cumulative update. This change only applies to PCs that get updates from Windows Update (WU) and Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). This change starts on June 27, 2023, for the Windows 11, version 22H2 cumulative update. \\r\\n\\r\\nSome PCs might not have a recovery partition that is large enough to complete this update. Because of this, the update for WinRE might fail. If you see a system event with an ID of 4502 triggered in C:\\\\Windows\\\\System32\\\\winevt\\\\logs\\\\system.evtx, it is likely an error due to insufficient space on the recovery partition that contains the WinRE. The details of this system event should show, \\\"Windows Recovery Environment servicing failed.\\\" with an ErrorPhase of 2. If that is the case, please follow the steps below to manually resize your recovery partition. This requires your device to have the recovery partition after the OS partition. Use the steps below to verify this. \\r\\n\\r\\n### Manually resize your partition by 250 MB\\r\\n\\r\\n1. Open a Command Prompt window (cmd) as admin.\\r\\n2. To check the WinRE status, run reagentc /info. If the WinRE is installed, there should be a ΓÇ£Windows RE locationΓÇ¥ with a path to the WinRE directory. An example is, ΓÇ£Windows RE location: [file://%3f/GLOBALROOT/device/harddisk0/partition4/Recovery/WindowsRE]\\\\\\\\?\\\\GLOBALROOT\\\\device\\\\harddisk0\\\\partition4\\\\Recovery\\\\WindowsRE.ΓÇ¥ Here, the number after ΓÇ£harddiskΓÇ¥ and ΓÇ£partitionΓÇ¥ is the index of the disk and partition WinRE is on.\\r\\n3. To disable the WinRE, run reagentc /disable\\r\\n4. Shrink the OS partition and prepare the disk for a new recovery partition.\\r\\n\\r\\n    1. To shrink the OS, run diskpart\\r\\n    2. Run list disk\\r\\n    3. To select the OS disk, run sel disk<OS disk index> This should be the same disk index as WinRE.\\r\\n    4. To check the partition under the OS disk and find the OS partition, run list part\\r\\n    5. To select the OS partition, run sel part*<OS partition index>*\\r\\n    6. Run shrink desired=250 minimum=250\\r\\n    7. To select the WinRE partition, run sel part*<WinRE partition index>*\\r\\n    8. To delete the WinRE partition, run delete partition override\\r\\n5. Create a new recovery partition.\\r\\n\\r\\n    1. First, check if the disk partition style is a GUID Partition Table (GPT) or a Master Boot Record (MBR). To do that, run list disk. Check if there is an asterisk character (\\\\*) in the ΓÇ£GptΓÇ¥ column. If there is an asterisk character (\\\\*), then the drive is GPT. Otherwise, the drive is MBR.\\r\\n\\r\\n        1. If your disk is GPT, run create partition primary id=de94bba4-06d1-4d40-a16a-bfd50179d6ac followed by the command gpt attributes =0x8000000000000001\\r\\n        2. If your disk is MBR, run create partition primary id=27\\r\\n    2. To format the partition, run format quick fs=ntfs label=ΓÇ¥Windows RE toolsΓÇ¥\\r\\n    3. If your disk is MBR, run set id=27\\r\\n6. To confirm that the WinRE partition is created, run list vol\\r\\n7. To exit from diskpart, run exit\\r\\n8. To re-enable WinRE, run reagentc /enable\\r\\n9. To confirm where WinRE is installed, run reagentc /info\\r\\n\\r\\n**Note** If creation failed or you do not want to extend the WinRE partition, run reagentc /enable to re-enable WinRE.\\r\\n\\r\\n[!\\\\[Facebook\\\\](/images/Facebook-GrayScale.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5028997-instructions-to-manually-resize-your-partition-to-install-the-winre-update-400faa27-9343-461c-ada9-24c8229763bf)[!\\\\[LinkedIn\\\\](/images/Linkedin-GrayScale.png)](https://linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5028997-instructions-to-manually-resize-your-partition-to-install-the-winre-update-400faa27-9343-461c-ada9-24c8229763bf&title=KB5028997%3A%20Instructions%20to%20manually%20resize%20your%20partition%20to%20install%20the%20WinRE%20update)[!\\\\[Email\\\\](/images/Mail-GrayScale.png)](mailto://?subject=I%20think%20you%27d%20be%20interested%20in%20this%3A%20KB5028997%3A%20Instructions%20to%20manually%20resize%20your%20partition%20to%20install%20the%20WinRE%20update&body=KB5028997%3A%20Instructions%20to%20manually%20resize%20your%20partition%20to%20install%20the%20WinRE%20update%20https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5028997-instructions-to-manually-resize-your-partition-to-install-the-winre-update-400faa27-9343-461c-ada9-24c8229763bf)\\r\\n\\r\\n[SUBSCRIBE {"diff":{"chunks":[{"diffString":"- 
+ Param (
+ [Parameter(Mandatory=$false,HelpMessage="Skip confirmation")][bool]$SkipConfirmation=$false,
+ [Parameter(Mandatory=$true,HelpMessage="Path to backup old WinRE partition content to")][string]$BackupFolder
+ )
+ # ------------------------------------
+ # Helper functions
+ # ------------------------------------
+ # Log message
+ function LogMessage([string]$message)
+ {
+   $message = "$message"
+   Write-Host $message
+ }
+ # Extract numbers from string
+ function ExtractNumbers([string]$str)
+ {
+   $cleanString = $str -replace "[^0-9]"
+   return [long]$cleanString
+ }
+ # Display partition info using fsutil
+ # Return an array, the first value is total size and the second value is free space
+ function DisplayPartitionInfo([string[]]$partitionPath)
+ {
+   $volume = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Volume | Where-Object { $partitionPath -contains $_.DeviceID }
+   LogMessage("  Partition capacity: " +  $volume.Capacity)
+   LogMessage("  Partition free space: " + $volume.FreeSpace)
+   return $volume.Capacity, $volume.FreeSpace
+ } 
+ # Display WinRE status
+ function DisplayWinREStatus()
+ {
+   # Get WinRE partition info

+ # ------------------------------------

+   $Needbackup = $true

+     $Needbackup = $false

# ------------------------------------
# Helper functions
# ------------------------------------
# Log message
function LogMessage([string]$message)
{
  $message = "$message"
  Write-Host $message
}
# Extract numbers from string
function ExtractNumbers([string]$str)
{
  $cleanString = $str -replace "[^0-9]"
  return [long]$cleanString
}
# Display partition info using fsutil
# Return an array, the first value is total size and the second value is free space
function DisplayPartitionInfo([string[]]$partitionPath)
{
  $volume = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Volume | Where-Object { $partitionPath -contains $_.DeviceID }
  LogMessage("  Partition capacity: " +  $volume.Capacity)
  LogMessage("  Partition free space: " + $volume.FreeSpace)
  return $volume.Capacity, $volume.FreeSpace
} 
# Display WinRE status
function DisplayWinREStatus()
{
  # Get WinRE partition info
  $WinREInfo = Reagentc /info
  foreach ($line in $WinREInfo)
  {
    $params = $line.Split(':')
    if ($params.Count -lt 2)
    {
      continue
    }
    if (($params[1].Trim() -ieq "Enabled") -Or (($params[1].Trim() -ieq "Disabled")))
    {
      $Status = $params[1].Trim() -ieq "Enabled"
      LogMessage($line.Trim())
    }
    if ($params[1].Trim() -like "\\?\GLOBALROOT*")
    {
      $Location = $params[1].Trim()
      LogMessage($line.Trim())
    }
  }
  
  return $Status, $Location
}
# ------------------------------------
# Main execution
# ------------------------------------
# Clear the error
$Error.Clear()
# ------------------------------------
# Examining the system to collect required info 
# for the execution
# Need to check WinRE status, collect OS and WinRE
# partition info
# ------------------------------------
LogMessage("Start time: $([DateTime]::Now)")
LogMessage("Examining the system...")
$NeedShrink = $true
$NeedCreateNew = $false
$NeedBackup = $false
# Get WinRE partition info
$InitialWinREStatus = DisplayWinREStatus
$WinREStatus = $InitialWinREStatus[0]
$WinRELocation = $InitialWinREStatus[1]
if (!$WinREStatus)
{
  LogMessage("Error: WinRE Disabled")
  exit 1
}
# Get System directory and ReAgent xml file
$system32Path = [System.Environment]::SystemDirectory
LogMessage("System directory: " + $system32Path)
$ReAgentXmlPath = Join-Path -Path $system32Path -ChildPath "\Recovery\ReAgent.xml"
LogMessage("ReAgent xml: " + $ReAgentXmlPath)
if (!(Test-Path  $ReAgentXmlPath))
{
  LogMessage("Error: ReAgent.xml cannot be found")
  exit 1
}
# Get OS partition
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Collecting OS and WinRE partition info...")
$OSDrive = $system32Path.Substring(0,1)
$OSPartition = Get-Partition -DriveLetter $OSDrive
# Get WinRE partition
$WinRELocationItems = $WinRELocation.Split('\\')
foreach ($item in $WinRELocationItems)
{
    if ($item -like "harddisk*")
  {
    $OSDiskIndex = ExtractNumbers($item)
  }
  if ($item -like "partition*")
  {
    $WinREPartitionIndex = ExtractNumbers($item)
  }
}
LogMessage("OS Disk: " + $OSDiskIndex)
LogMessage("OS Partition: " + $OSPartition.PartitionNumber)
LogMessage("WinRE Partition: " + $WinREPartitionIndex)
$WinREPartition = Get-Partition -DiskNumber $OSDiskIndex -PartitionNumber $WinREPartitionIndex
$diskInfo = Get-Disk -number $OSDiskIndex
$diskType = $diskInfo.PartitionStyle
LogMessage("Disk PartitionStyle: " + $diskType)
# Display WinRE partition size info
LogMessage("WinRE partition size info")
$WinREPartitionSizeInfo = DisplayPartitionInfo($WinREPartition.AccessPaths)
LogMessage("WinRE Partition Offset: " + $WinREPartition.Offset)
LogMessage("WinRE Partition Type: " + $WinREPartition.Type)
LogMessage("OS partition size: " + $OSPartition.Size)
LogMessage("OS partition Offset: " + $OSPartition.Offset)
$OSPartitionEnds = $OSPartition.Offset + $OSPartition.Size
LogMessage("OS partition ends at: " + $OSPartitionEnds)
LogMessage("WinRE partition starts at: " + $WinREPartition.Offset)
$WinREIsOnSystemPartition = $false
if ($diskType -ieq "MBR")
{
  if ($WinREPartition.IsActive)
  {
    LogMessage("WinRE is on System partition")
    $WinREIsOnSystemPartition = $true
  }
}
if ($diskType -ieq "GPT")
{
  if ($WinREPartition.Type -ieq "System")
  {
    LogMessage("WinRE is on System partition")
    $WinREIsOnSystemPartition = $true
  }
}
# Checking the BackupFolder parameter
if ($PSBoundParameters.ContainsKey('BackupFolder'))
{
  LogMessage("")
  LogMessage("Backup Directory: [" + $BackupFolder + "]")
  
  $Needbackup = $true
  
  if ($WinREIsOnSystemPartition)
  {
    $Needbackup = $false
    LogMessage("WinRE is on System partition which will be preserved. No need to backup content")
  }
  else
  {
    if (Test-path $BackupFolder)
    {
      $items = Get-ChildItem -Path $BackupFolder
      if ($items)
      {
        LogMessage("Error: Existing backup directory is not empty")
        exit 1
      }
    }
    else
    {
      LogMessage("Creating backup directory...")
      try 
      {
        $item = New-Item -Path $BackupFolder -ItemType Directory -ErrorAction Stop
        if ($item)
        {
          LogMessage("Backup directory created")
        }
        else
        {
          LogMessage("Error: Failed to create backup directory [" + $BackupFolder + "]")
          exit 1
        }
      } catch 
      {
        LogMessage("Error: An error occurred: $_")
        exit 1
      }
    }
  }
}
# ------------------------------------
# Verify whether we meet requirements of execution
# - WinRE cannot be on OS partition for the extension
# - WinRE partition must be the next partition after OS partition
# - If WinRE partition already have >=250MB free space, no need to do repartition
# - If there is enough unallocated space to grow the WinRE partition size, skip shrinking OS
# 
# However, if the WinRE partition is before the OS partition, there is no chance to extend it
# As a result, it's better to create a new WinRE partition after the OS partition
# ------------------------------------
# Perform a few checks
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Verifying if the WinRE partition needs to be extended or not...")
if (!(($diskType -ieq "MBR") -Or ($diskType -ieq "GPT")))
{
  LogMessage("Error: Got an unexpected disk partition style: " +$diskType)
  exit 1
}
# WinRE partition must be after OS partition for the repartition
if ($WinREPartitionIndex -eq $OSPartition.PartitionNumber)
{
  LogMessage("WinRE and OS are on the same partition, should not perform extension")
  exit 0
}
$supportedSize = Get-PartitionSupportedSize -DriveLetter $OSDrive
# if there is enough free space, skip extension
if ($WinREPartitionSizeInfo[1] -ge 250MB)
{
  LogMessage("More than 250 MB of free space was detected in the WinRE partition, there is no need to extend the partition")
  exit 0
}
if ($WinREPartition.Offset -lt $OSPartitionEnds)
{
  LogMessage("WinRE partition is not after OS partition, cannot perform extension")
  LogMessage("Need to create a new WinRE partition after OS partition")
  $NeedCreateNew = $true
  $NeedShrink = $true
  
  # Calculate the size of repartition
  # Will create a new WinRE partition with current WinRE partition size + 250 MB
  # The OS partition size will be shrunk by the new WinRE partition size
  $targetWinREPartitionSize = $WinREPartitionSizeInfo[0] + 250MB
  $shrinkSize = [Math]::Ceiling($targetWinREPartitionSize / 1MB) * 1MB
  $targetOSPartitionSize = $OSPartition.Size - $shrinkSize
  if ($targetOSPartitionSize -lt $supportedSize.SizeMin)
  {
    LogMessage("Error: The target OS partition size after shrinking is smaller than the supported minimum size, cannot perform the repartition")
    exit 1
  }
}
else
{
  if ($WinREIsOnSystemPartition)
  {
    LogMessage("WinRE parititon is after the OS partition and it's also System partition")
    LogMessage("Error: Got unexpected disk layout, cannot proceed")
    exit 1
  }
  if (!($WinREPartitionIndex -eq ($OSPartition.PartitionNumber + 1)))
  {
    LogMessage("Error: WinRE partition is not right after the OS partition, cannot extend WinRE partition")
    exit 1
  }
  # Calculate the size of repartition
  # Will shrink OS partitition by 250 MB
  $shrinkSize = 250MB
  $targetOSPartitionSize = $OSPartition.Size - $shrinkSize
  $targetWinREPartitionSize = $WinREPartitionSizeInfo[0] + 250MB
  $UnallocatedSpace = $WinREPartition.Offset - $OSPartitionEnds;
  # If there is unallocated space, consider using it
  if ($UnallocatedSpace -ge 250MB)
  {
    $UnallocatedSpace = $WinREPartition.Offset - $OSPartitionEnds;
    LogMessage("Found unallocated space between OS and WinRE partition: " + $UnallocatedSpace)
    LogMessage("There is already enough space to extend WinRE partition without shrinking the OS partition")
    $NeedShrink = $false
    $targetOSPartitionSize = 0
  }
  else
  {
    $shrinkSize = [Math]::Ceiling((250MB - $UnallocatedSpace)/ 1MB) * 1MB
    if ($shrinkSize > 250MB)
    {
      $shrinkSize = 250MB
    }
    $targetOSPartitionSize = $OSPartition.Size - $shrinkSize
    if ($targetOSPartitionSize -lt $supportedSize.SizeMin)
    {
      LogMessage("Error: The target OS partition size after shrinking is smaller than the supported minimum size, cannot perform the repartition")
      exit 1
    }
  }
}
# ------------------------------------
# Report execution plan and ask for user confirmation to continue
# ------------------------------------
# Report the changes planned to be executed, waiting for user confirmation
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Summary of proposed changes")
if ($NeedCreateNew)
{
  LogMessage("Note: WinRE partition is before OS partition, need to create a new WinRE partition after OS partition")
  LogMessage("Will shrink OS partition by " + $shrinkSize)
  LogMessage("  Current OS partition size: " + $OSPartition.Size)
  LogMessage("  Target OS partition size after shrinking: " + $targetOSPartitionSize)
  LogMessage("New WinRE partition will be created with size: ", $targetWinREPartitionSize)
  if ($WinREIsOnSystemPartition)
  {
    LogMessage("Existing WinRE partition is also system partition, it will be preserved")
  }
  else
  {
    LogMessage("Existing WinRE partition will be deleted")
    LogMessage("  WinRE partition: Disk [" + $OSDiskIndex + "] Partition [" + $WinREPartitionIndex + "]")
    LogMessage("  Current WinRE partition size: " + $WinREPartitionSizeInfo[0])
  }
}
else
{
  if ($NeedShrink)
  {
    LogMessage("Will shrink OS partition by " + $shrinkSize)
    LogMessage("  Current OS partition size: " + $OSPartition.Size)
    LogMessage("  Target OS partition size after shrinking: " + $targetOSPartitionSize)
    if ($UnallocatedSpace -ge 0)
    {
      LogMessage("Unallocated space between OS and WinRE partition that will be used towards the new WinRE partition: " + $UnallocatedSpace)
    }
  }
  else
  {
    LogMessage("Will use 250MB from unallocated space between OS and WinRE partition")
  }
  LogMessage("Will extend WinRE partition size by 250MB")
  LogMessage("  WinRE partition: Disk [" + $OSDiskIndex + "] Partition [" + $WinREPartitionIndex + "]")
  LogMessage("  Current WinRE partition size: " + $WinREPartitionSizeInfo[0])
  LogMessage("  New WinRE partition size:     " + $targetWinREPartitionSize)
  LogMessage("WinRE will be temporarily disabled before extending the WinRE partition and enabled automatically in the end")
  if ($UnallocatedSpace -ge 100MB)
  {
    LogMessage("Warning: More than 100MB of unallocated space was detected between the OS and WinRE partitions")
    LogMessage("Would you like to proceed by using the unallocated space between the OS and the WinRE partitions?")
  }
}
if ($Needbackup)
{
  LogMessage("")
  LogMessage("The contents of the old WinRE partition will be backed up to [" + $BackupFolder + "]")
}
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Please reboot the device before running this script to ensure any pending partition actions are finalized")
LogMessage("")
if ($SkipConfirmation)
{
  LogMessage("User chose to skip confirmation")
  LogMessage("Proceeding with changes...")
}
else
{
  $userInput = Read-Host -Prompt "Would you like to proceed? Y for Yes and N for No"
    
  if ($userInput -ieq "Y")
  {
    LogMessage("Proceeding with changes...")
  }
  elseif ($userInput -ieq "N")
  {
    LogMessage("Canceling based on user request, no changes were made to the system")
    exit 0
  }
  else
  {
    LogMessage("Error: Unexpected user input: [" + $userInput + "]") 
    exit 0
  }
}
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Note: To prevent unexpected results, please do not interrupt the execution or restart your system")
# ------------------------------------
# Do the actual execution
# The main flow is:
# 1. Check whether ReAgent.xml has stage location and clear it for repartiion
# 2. Disable WinRE as WinRE partition will be deleted
# 3. Perform the repartition to create a larger WinRE partition
# 4. Re-enable WinRE
# ------------------------------------
LogMessage("")
# Load ReAgent.xml to clear Stage location
LogMessage("Loading [" + $ReAgentXmlPath + "] ...")
$xml = [xml](Get-Content -Path $ReAgentXmlPath)
$node = $xml.WindowsRE.ImageLocation
if (($node.path -eq "") -And ($node.guid -eq "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}") -And ($node.offset -eq "0") -And ($node.id -eq "0"))
{
  LogMessage("Stage location info is empty")
}
else
{
  LogMessage("Clearing stage location info...")
  $node.path = ""
  $node.offset = "0"
  $node.guid= "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}"
  $node.id="0"
  # Save the change
  LogMessage("Saving changes to [" + $ReAgentXmlPath + "]...")
  $xml.Save($ReAgentXmlPath)
}
# Disable WinRE
LogMessage("Disabling WinRE...")
reagentc /disable
if (!($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0))
{
  LogMessage("Warning: encountered an error when disabling WinRE: " + $LASTEXITCODE)
  exit $LASTEXITCODE
}
# Verify WinRE is under C:\Windows\System32\Recovery\WinRE.wim
$disableWinREPath = Join-Path -Path $system32Path -ChildPath "\Recovery\WinRE.wim"
LogMessage("Verifying that WinRE wim exists in downlevel at default location")
if (!(Test-Path $disableWinREPath))
{
  LogMessage("Error: Cannot find " + $disableWinREPath)
  
  # Re-enable WinRE
  LogMessage("Re-enabling WinRE on error...")
  reagentc /enable
  if (!($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0))
  {
    LogMessage("Warning: encountered an error when enabling WinRE: " + $LASTEXITCODE)
  }
  exit 1
}
# ------------------------------------
# Perform the repartition
# 1. Resize the OS partition
# 2. Delete the WinRE partition
# 3. Create a new WinRE partition
# ------------------------------------
LogMessage("Performing repartition to extend the WinRE partition ...")
# 1. Resize the OS partition
if ($NeedShrink)
{
  LogMessage("Shrinking the OS partition to create a larger WinRE partition")
  LogMessage("Resizing the OS partition to: [" + $targetOSPartitionSize + "]...")
  Resize-Partition -DriveLetter $OSDrive -Size $targetOSPartitionSize
  if ($Error.Count -gt 0) {
    LogMessage("Error: Resize-Partition encountered errors: " + $Error[0].Exception.Message)
    
    # Re-enable WinRE
    LogMessage("Re-enabling WinRE on error...")
    reagentc /enable
    if (!($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0))
    {
      LogMessage("Warning: encountered an error when enabling WinRE: " + $LASTEXITCODE)
    }
    exit 1
  }
  $OSPartitionAfterShrink = Get-Partition -DriveLetter $OSDrive
  LogMessage("Target partition size: " + $targetOSPartitionSize)
  LogMessage("Size of OS partition after shrinking: " + $OSPartitionAfterShrink.Size)
}
# 2. Delete the WinRE partition
LogMessage("")
if ($WinREIsOnSystemPartition)
{
  LogMessage("Existing WinRE partition is System partition, skipping deletion")
}
else
{  
  # If requested by user, backup rest of the content on WinRE partition to backup directory
  if ($Needbackup)
  {
    $sourcePath = $WinREPartition.AccessPaths[0] 
    LogMessage("Copying content on WinRE partition from [" + $sourcePath + "] to [" + $BackupFolder + "]...")
    
    # Copy-Item may have access issue with certain system folders, enumerate the children items and exlcude them
    $items = Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath $sourcePath -Force
    foreach ($item in $items)
    {
      if ($item.Name -ieq "System Volume Information")
      {
        continue
      }
      $sourceItemPath = Join-Path -Path $sourcePath -ChildPath $item.Name
      $destItemPath = Join-Path -Path $BackupFolder -ChildPath $item.Name
      try 
      {
        LogMessage("Copying [" + $sourceItemPath + "] to [" + $destItemPath + "]...")
        Copy-Item -LiteralPath $sourceItemPath -Destination $destItemPath -Recurse -Force
      } catch 
      {
        LogMessage("Error: An error occurred during copy: $_")
        exit 1
      }
    }
    
    LogMessage("Backup completed")
    LogMessage("")
  }
  LogMessage("Deleting WinRE partition: Disk [" + $OSDiskIndex + "] Partition [" + $WinREPartitionIndex + "]...")
  Remove-Partition -DiskNumber $OSDiskIndex -PartitionNumber $WinREPartitionIndex -Confirm:$false
  if ($Error.Count -gt 0) {
    LogMessage("Error: Remove-Partition encountered errors: " + $Error[0].Exception.Message)
    exit 1
  }
}
# A short sleep for the partition change
Sleep 5
# 3. Create a new WinRE partition
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Creating new WinRE partition...")
LogMessage("Target size: " + $targetWinREPartitionSize)
if ($diskType -ieq "GPT")
{
  $partition = New-Partition -DiskNumber $OSDiskIndex -Size $targetWinREPartitionSize -GptType "{de94bba4-06d1-4d40-a16a-bfd50179d6ac}"
  
  $newPartitionIndex = $partition.PartitionNumber
  # A short sleep to make sure the partition is ready for formatting
  Sleep 2
  LogMessage("Formating the partition...")
  $result = Format-Volume -Partition $partition -FileSystem NTFS -Confirm:$false
  if ($Error.Count -gt 0) {
    LogMessage("Error: Format-Volume encountered errors: " + $Error[0].Exception.Message)
    exit 1
  }
}
else
{
  #$partition = New-Partition -DiskNumber $OSDiskIndex -Size $targetWinREPartitionSize -MbrType 0x27
  $targetWinREPartitionSizeInMb = [int]($targetWinREPartitionSize/1MB)
  $diskpartScript = 
@"
select disk $OSDiskIndex
create partition primary size=$targetWinREPartitionSizeInMb id=27
format quick fs=ntfs label="Recovery"
set id=27
"@
  $TempPath = $env:Temp
  $diskpartSciptFile = Join-Path -Path $TempPath -ChildPath "\ExtendWinRE_MBR_PowershellScript.txt"
  
  LogMessage("Creating temporary diskpart script to create Recovery partition on MBR disk...")
  LogMessage("Temporary diskpart script file: " + $diskpartSciptFile)
  $diskpartScript | Out-File -FilePath $diskpartSciptFile -Encoding ascii
  
  LogMessage("Executing diskpart script...")
  try 
  {
    $diskpartOutput = diskpart /s $diskpartSciptFile
    
    if ($diskpartOutput -match "DiskPart successfully") 
    {
      LogMessage("Diskpart script executed successfully")
    }
    else
    {
      LogMessage("Error executing diskpart script:" + $diskpartOutput)
      exit 1
    }
    LogMessage("Deleting temporary diskpart script file...")
    Remove-Item $diskpartSciptFile
  }
  catch 
  {
    LogMessage("Error executing diskpart script: $_")
    exit 1
  }
  
  $vol = Get-Volume -FileSystemLabel "Recovery"
  $newPartitionIndex = (Get-Partition | Where-Object { $_.AccessPaths -contains $vol.Path } ).PartitionNumber
}
if ($Error.Count -gt 0) 
{
  LogMessage("Error: New-Partition encountered errors: " + $Error[0].Exception.Message)
  exit 1
}
LogMessage("New Partition index: " + $newPartitionIndex)
# Re-enable WinRE
LogMessage("Re-enabling WinRE...")
reagentc /enable
if (!($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0))
{
  LogMessage("Warning: encountered an error when enabling WinRE: " + $LASTEXITCODE)
  exit $LASTEXITCODE
}
# In the end, Display WinRE status to verify WinRE is enabled correctly
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("WinRE Information:")
$FinalWinREStatus = DisplayWinREStatus
$WinREStatus = $FinalWinREStatus[0]
$WinRELocation = $FinalWinREStatus[1]
if (!$WinREStatus)
{
  LogMessage("Warning: WinRE Disabled")
}
$WinRELocationItems = $WinRELocation.Split('\\')
foreach ($item in $WinRELocationItems)
{
  if ($item -like "partition*")
  {
    $WinREPartitionIndex = ExtractNumbers($item)
  }
}
LogMessage("WinRE Partition Index: " + $WinREPartitionIndex)
$WinREPartition = Get-Partition -DiskNumber $OSDiskIndex -PartitionNumber $WinREPartitionIndex
$WinREPartitionSizeInfoAfter = DisplayPartitionInfo($WinREPartition.AccessPaths)
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("OS Information:")
$OSPartition = Get-Partition -DriveLetter $OSDrive
LogMessage("OS partition size: " + $OSPartition.Size)
LogMessage("OS partition Offset: " + $OSPartition.Offset)
if (!($WinREPartitionIndex -eq $newPartitionIndex))
{
  LogMessage("Warning: WinRE is installed to partition [" + $WinREPartitionIndex +"], but the newly created Recovery partition is [" + $newPartitionIndex + "]")
}
LogMessage("End time: $([DateTime]::Now)")
if ($NeedBackup)
{
  LogMessage("")
  LogMessage("The contents of the old WinRE partition has been backed up to [" + $BackupFolder + "]")
}
LogMessage("")
LogMessage("Successfully completed the operation")

"}

data.text:
Here is the consolidated, specific instruction set for the Cursor IDE LLM. You can paste this directly into **Cursor Chat (Ctrl+L)** to have it finalize and verify the setup.



This prompt forces the Agent to check its own work (the scripts it generated) and ensure the configuration aligns perfectly with the "Sandwich" architecture we established.

---

### Prompt for Cursor IDE LLM (Final Verification & Setup)

```markdown

We are finalizing the local "Sandwich" architecture:

1.  **Llamafile (Glue):** Qwen 2.5 Coder 7B running on GPU (Port 8080).

2.  **Built-in MCP (Context):** Hugging Face Remote API.

3.  **SaaS (Architect):** Opus/Claude.

You previously generated the scripts in `C:\llamafile-llm\`. I need you to perform a final audit and configuration step to ensure everything is wired correctly.

### Step 1: Verify & Correct `start-llm.ps1`

Please read the content of `C:\llamafile-llm\start-llm.ps1` and ensure it contains these **Exact Flags** for my RTX 4060:

*   `-m qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf` (Verify filename matches download).

*   `-ngl 999` (Force full GPU offload).

*   `-c 8192` (8k Context).

*   `--host 127.0.0.1 --port 8080` (Localhost only).

*   `--nobrowser` (Do not auto-open browser tab).

*   *If any flags are missing or wrong, provide the corrected PowerShell script content now.*

### Step 2: Verify `test-api.ps1`

Ensure the test script uses the correct endpoint:

*   URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions`

*   JSON Body: `{ "model": "qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf", "messages": [...] }`

*   *Provide the corrected script if needed.*

### Step 3: Define Cursor "Rules for AI" (System Prompt)

I need a specific System Prompt to put in **Cursor Settings > General > Rules for AI**.

Generate a prompt that enforces this behavior:

*   **Role:** "You are a fast, local code finisher."

*   **Constraint:** "Output ONLY the requested code snippet or completion. Do not explain. Do not chat. Do not repeat imports unless asked."

*   **Context:** "Assume the user is working in a scaffolded project (Rust/C/JS). Maintain existing style."

### Step 4: Final Config Checklist

Output a final checklist for me to verify manually:

1.  **Move GGUF:** Confirm source path (`Downloads/...`) and destination (`C:\llamafile-llm\`).

2.  **Cursor Model Config:**

    *   **Name:** `local-qwen-7b`

    *   **Base URL:** `http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1`

    *   **Model ID:** `qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf`

3.  **MCP Config:** Confirm `%USERPROFILE%\.cursor\mcp.json` still points to `https://huggingface.co/mcp` (Remote).

DO NOT generate new files. Read the existing ones, provide corrections if needed, and give me the text to copy-paste into settings.

```

### Why this specific prompt?

1.  **Audits the `-ngl` flag:** This is the #1 failure point. If `start-llm.ps1` defaults to CPU, your experience will be terrible. This forces the agent to check it.

2.  **Fixes the Model ID:** Llamafile is picky about the model ID matching the loaded filename in some modes. This ensures consistency between the script and Cursor settings.

3.  **Sets the "Persona":** The "Rules for AI" step is crucial. Without it, the 7B model might try to be too chatty, which wastes tokens and slows down your "Finisher" workflow.

HereΓÇÖs a compact, explicit instruction block you can paste into **Cursor Chat (Ctrl+L)** for the Cursor LLM/Agent to follow.



```text

You previously helped set up a Python + PyTorch + transformers stack and wired CursorΓÇÖs MCP to Hugging FaceΓÇÖs remote MCP server. That was useful to test the GPU and MCP, but for my main local LLM I want a much lighter architecture:



- Local LLM: **llamafile.exe** + **Qwen 2.5 Coder 7B Instruct Q4_K_M GGUF** as a small, fast ΓÇ£finisher/glueΓÇ¥ model.

- Remote tools: existing **Hugging Face MCP** at https://huggingface.co/mcp, used ONLY for remote context (Hub/Spaces/docs/search), NOT for local inference.

- SaaS model: Claude/Opus remains the ΓÇ£architectΓÇ¥ for multi-file reasoning.



My machine:

- Windows 11 Pro x64

- AMD Ryzen 7 7700

- RTX 4060 8 GB VRAM

- 16 GB RAM

- Cursor latest, with `%USERPROFILE%\.cursor\mcp.json` already containing a ΓÇ£Hugging FaceΓÇ¥ entry pointing to `https://huggingface.co/mcp`.



DO NOT:

- Reinstall or reconfigure Python/PyTorch/transformers for my main code model.

- Create any new MCP servers beyond the existing Hugging Face MCP.

- Configure any local transformer/embedding models via MCP.



INSTRUCTIONS ΓÇô FOLLOW THESE STEPS ONLY



### 1. Confirm cleanup and current files



1. Verify that the Python venv you created earlier for HF MCP inference (e.g. a `huggingface-mcp/.venv` folder) is no longer in use and can be ignored for this setup. Do NOT delete anything automatically; just explain that itΓÇÖs optional now.

2. Confirm that `%USERPROFILE%\.cursor\mcp.json` still contains a ΓÇ£Hugging FaceΓÇ¥ entry like:



   ```json

   "Hugging Face": {

     "url": "https://huggingface.co/mcp",

     "headers": {

       "Authorization": "Bearer hf_...TOKEN..."

     }

   }

   ```



   and explicitly state that this is a **remote MCP tool**, not a local model host, and we will keep it as-is.



3. Confirm that in `C:\llamafile-llm\` we have (or will have):



   - `llamafile.exe`  (Γëê293 MB)

   - `qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf`  (Γëê4.68 GB)

   - `start-llm.ps1`

   - `test-api.ps1`

   - `README.md`



If the GGUF is still in a temp downloads folder (e.g. `C:\Users\user\Downloads\Cursor_working_directory_misc\`), give a single PowerShell `Move-Item` command to move it into `C:\llamafile-llm\` and tell me to run it manually.



### 2. Verify and, if needed, fix `start-llm.ps1`



Open or show the contents you previously wrote to `C:\llamafile-llm\start-llm.ps1`. It should effectively be:



```powershell

cd C:\llamafile-llm



.\llamafile.exe `

  -m qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf `

  -ngl 99 `

  -c 8192 `

  --host 127.0.0.1 `

  --port 8080

```



If anything important is missing or different, propose the corrected script and tell me to overwrite `start-llm.ps1` with your corrected version. Key points:



- `-m` uses `qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf` in the same folder.

- `-ngl 99` (or similar high value) enables full GPU offload for the RTX 4060.

- `-c 8192` sets an 8k context.

- `--host 127.0.0.1 --port 8080` binds the HTTP server to localhost:8080.



Explicitly state that this will run the model primarily in GPU VRAM with a small RAM footprint.



### 3. Verify and, if needed, fix `test-api.ps1`



Show the contents of `C:\llamafile-llm\test-api.ps1`. It should:



- Call `http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions`

- Use a JSON body with a `model` field and a simple prompt.

- Use the same model name that I will configure in Cursor (either the GGUF filename or a short alias, but be consistent).



If needed, propose a correct minimal version, e.g.:



```powershell

$body = @{

  model = "qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf"

  messages = @(

    @{ role = "user"; content = "Say hello in one short sentence." }

  )

} | ConvertTo-Json



Invoke-RestMethod `

  -Uri "http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions" `

  -Method POST `

  -ContentType "application/json" `

  -Body $body

```



Tell me to adjust `"model"` if you prefer a shorter alias and you will tell me what that alias should be for Cursor.



### 4. Start the server and test it



Give me explicit instructions:



1. In a PowerShell window:



   ```powershell

   cd C:\llamafile-llm

   .\start-llm.ps1

   ```



   Tell me what I should see in the console (e.g. that it loads the GGUF, shows a number of GPU layers offloaded, and is listening on port 8080).



2. In another PowerShell window:



   ```powershell

   cd C:\llamafile-llm

   .\test-api.ps1

   ```



   Explain what a successful response looks like (JSON with a `choices` array and assistant content), and that if it works, Cursor will be able to use this endpoint.



Optionally, provide a `Invoke-RestMethod` example that hits `/v1/models` if llamafile supports that, to confirm the server is up.



### 5. Register llamafile as a custom model in Cursor



Give a short, exact ΓÇ£clickΓÇæpathΓÇ¥ with values:



1. Open **Cursor Settings ΓåÆ Models**.

2. Click to **Add OpenAIΓÇæcompatible model**.

3. Fill in:

   - **Name / Label**: `local-qwen-7b` (this is what IΓÇÖll see in the dropdown).

   - **Base URL**: `http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1`

   - **API key**: any dummy string (e.g. `sk-local-test`), since llamafile will ignore it.

   - **Model ID**: **exactly** the string you used in the `"model"` field in `test-api.ps1` (e.g. `qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf` or `local-qwen-7b`).



4. Tell me to save this model and then:

   - Open a code file,

   - Select a function body,

   - Press **Ctrl+K**, choose `local-qwen-7b`, and try a simple prompt like ΓÇ£Implement this function in CΓÇ¥ to verify local completions work.



### 6. Usage patterns and resource notes



Summarize how I should use the models in Cursor:



- **Ctrl+K (Edit selection, single file):** choose `local-qwen-7b` for fast local codegen/fixes.

- **Ctrl+L (Chat, multiΓÇæfile reasoning):** keep using SaaS (Claude/Opus).

- **Tab autocomplete:** fine to leave on CursorΓÇÖs default cloud model.



Also include a short recommended ΓÇ£behavior/system promptΓÇ¥ I can use when invoking the local model, for example:



> ΓÇ£You are a fast, local code finisher running inside an alreadyΓÇæscaffolded project. Only generate or modify the minimal code or configuration requested in the selection or prompt. Do NOT reΓÇæemit entire files unless explicitly asked. Do not explain; output only code or configuration that fits into the existing file.ΓÇ¥



And finally, remind me:



- A 7B Q4/Q5 model is appropriate for RTX 4060 8GB + 16 GB RAM.

- I should avoid running any large Python/PyTorch inference services at the same time as Cursor + llamafile.

- ItΓÇÖs a good idea to stop the llamafile server when doing very heavy builds (large Gradle/Android or Rust builds).

- I can watch RAM and VRAM with:

  - Task Manager (check `llamafile.exe` and `cursor.exe`),

  - `nvidia-smi` (if available) to confirm ~5ΓÇô6 GB VRAM usage for the model.



Please now:

- Confirm the file locations and contents (`start-llm.ps1`, `test-api.ps1`),

- Give me any corrections needed,

- And restate the final Cursor Models configuration values I should enter.

```



This is the consolidated instruction set: you can paste it into Cursor Chat and the LLM/agent should follow it stepΓÇæbyΓÇæstep, without drifting back into heavy Python/MCPΓÇæbased inference.

data.text:
---

## Final Setup - Complete Instructions

### Download Status

GGUF: **2.3 GB / 4.68 GB (~49%)** - Still downloading

---

### 1. Move GGUF (After Download Completes)

**Run this AFTER the download is 100% complete (file size ~4.68 GB):**

```powershell
Move-Item "C:\Users\user\Downloads\Cursor_working_directory_misc\qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf" "C:\llamafile-llm\"
```

---

### 2. Scripts Updated

**`C:\llamafile-llm\start-llm.ps1`** (VRAM-safe, 4K context):

```powershell
.\llamafile.exe `
    -m qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf `
    -ngl 99 `
    -c 4096 `
    --host 127.0.0.1 `
    --port 8080 `
    --nobrowser
```

**`C:\llamafile-llm\test-api.ps1`** (matches Cursor Model ID):

```powershell
$body = @{
    model = "qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf"
    messages = @(
        @{ role = "user"; content = "Say hello in one short sentence." }
    )
} | ConvertTo-Json

Invoke-RestMethod `
    -Uri "http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions" `
    -Method POST `
    -ContentType "application/json" `
    -Body $body
```

---

### 3. Start & Test

**Terminal 1 - Start Server:**

```powershell
cd C:\llamafile-llm
.\start-llm.ps1
```

**Expected output:**

```
Starting llamafile server...
Model: qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf
Endpoint: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1

llama_model_loader: loaded meta data with 33 key-value pairs...
llm_load_tensors: offloading 28 layers to GPU
...
llama server listening at http://127.0.0.1:8080
```

**Terminal 2 - Test API:**

```powershell
cd C:\llamafile-llm
.\test-api.ps1
```

**Expected output:**

```
Testing llamafile API...
POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions

SUCCESS
Response: Hello! How can I assist you today?
```

---

### 4. Cursor Model Configuration

1. Open **Settings** (Ctrl+,)
2. Navigate to **Models**
3. Click **Add OpenAI-compatible model**
4. Fill in:

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Name** | `local-qwen-7b` |
| **Base URL** | `http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1` |
| **API Key** | `sk-local-not-needed` |
| **Model ID** | `qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf` |

5. Save

6. Test: Open a code file, select a function, press **Ctrl+K**, choose `local-qwen-7b`, prompt: "Implement this function"

---

### 5. Rules for AI (System Prompt)

Add to **Cursor Settings > General > Rules for AI**:

```
When using local-qwen-7b:
You are a fast, local code finisher running inside an already-scaffolded project.
- Output ONLY the requested code snippet or completion
- Do NOT explain, chat, or add commentary
- Do NOT re-emit entire files unless explicitly asked
- Do NOT repeat imports unless asked
- Maintain existing code style (indentation, naming conventions)
- Assume context: C, Rust, JS, PHP, Python, Java, shell, CMake, Docker, YAML
```

---

### 6. Usage Patterns

| Action | Model | Purpose |
|--------|-------|---------|
| **Ctrl+K** (edit selection) | `local-qwen-7b` | Fast local finisher |
| **Ctrl+L** (chat/reasoning) | Claude/Opus | Multi-file context |
| **Tab autocomplete** | Cursor default | Cloud completion |

---

### 7. Architecture Summary

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Cursor IDE       | --> | llamafile.exe     | --> | RTX 4060 GPU     |
| (Ctrl+K edits)   |     | :8080/v1          |     | ~5-6 GB VRAM     |
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
        |
        v
+------------------+
| HF MCP (remote)  |  <-- Hub search, docs, examples (NOT local inference)
| huggingface.co   |
+------------------+
        |
        v
+------------------+
| Claude/Opus      |  <-- Multi-file reasoning, Ctrl+L chat
| (SaaS)           |
+------------------+
```

---

### 8. Resource Notes

| Component | VRAM | RAM |
|-----------|------|-----|
| Qwen 7B Q4 + 4K context | ~5-6 GB | ~200 MB |
| Cursor + indexer | - | ~1-2 GB |
| **Headroom** | ~2 GB | ~12 GB |

- Run **one** llamafile server at a time
- Stop server during heavy builds (Android Gradle, large Rust)
- Monitor with Task Manager or `nvidia-smi`

---

### 9. Hugging Face MCP (Unchanged)

Your `mcp.json` entry:

```json
"Hugging Face": {
  "url": "https://huggingface.co/mcp",
  "headers": { "Authorization": "Bearer <TOKEN>" }
}
```

This is a **REMOTE tool** for Hub/Spaces/docs. It does **NOT** run local inference and must **NOT** be wired to llamafile.

{"contents":"# Cursor Rules - Workspace Root

## MANDATORY: Read AGENT_ONBOARD.md First

Before ANY code generation, read `AGENT_ONBOARD.md` for:
- Helper script index (minimizes token usage)
- Template system usage
- Validation requirements

## Core Constraints

- No emojis in code, configs, or documentation
- Default languages: PowerShell (Win), POSIX sh (Unix), C17, AMD64/ARM64 ASM
- BSD-2-Clause license with DCO sign-off
- Use existing helper scripts instead of generating equivalent commands

## Script Locations

Helper scripts are in:
`github-backup/cursor-project-scaffolding-backup/ludoplex-cursor-project-scaffolding-backup-*/`

Key directories:
- `git-ops/` - Git and GitHub operations
- `utils/` - File search, project structure
- `prr/` - Production readiness checks
- `templates/` - Project templates

## Universal Config Paradigm

All configuration uses `.cfg` files with `KEY=VALUE` format.
Each task has three consumers:
1. POSIX shell script (macOS/Linux)
2. PowerShell v5 script (Windows 10)
3. PowerShell v7 script (Windows 11 / cross-platform)

## Token Efficiency Rules

DO invoke single helper scripts:
```powershell
.\git-ops\New-Repo.ps1 -Path "." -Private -WithBackup
```

DO NOT generate multi-command sequences:
```powershell
# BAD - wastes ~1000 tokens
gh repo create...
git init...
git remote add...
# etc.
```

## Before Completing Work

1. Run aggregate linting: `.\Lint-Project-v7.ps1` (uses lint.cfg)
2. Run PRR checks: `.\prr\Invoke-PRR.ps1 -ProjectPath .`
3. Validate configs: `./scripts/json-configs.sh`
4. Validate workflows: `./scripts/workflows.sh`
5. Run tests: `./scripts/run-core-tests.sh`

## Project Agent Instructions

Check for project-specific instructions:
- `.copilot/*.md` - Agent role instructions
- `.github/agents.yml` - Agent trigger definitions
- `AGENT_ONBOARD.md` - This workspace's helper index

## Platform Detection

Scripts auto-detect and set appropriate defaults.
Override only when project requirements differ from platform defaults.

## Tech Stack Reconnaissance - MANDATORY (Fravia/Suckless Method)

Before ANY browser automation, you MUST:

### Step 1: Download Raw HTML
```powershell
$html = (Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "$URL" -UseBasicParsing).Content
$html | Out-File -FilePath "site_source.html" -Encoding UTF8
```

### Step 2: Identify Tech Stack
```powershell
# Check for CMS/framework signatures
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern "wp-content|wp-includes"  # WordPress
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern "DocumentCenter|CivicEngage"  # CivicPlus
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern "evogov|EvoGov"  # EvoGov
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern "drupal|sites/default"  # Drupal
```

### Step 3: Predict URL Patterns from Stack

| Tech Stack | Document URL Pattern |
|------------|---------------------|
| WordPress | `/wp-content/uploads/YYYY/MM/filename.pdf` |
| CivicPlus | `/DocumentCenter/View/ID/filename` |
| EvoGov | `/media/ID/filename.pdf` |
| Drupal | `/sites/default/files/filename.pdf` |

### Step 4: Search for Target Files in HTML
```powershell
# Find all PDF links
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern 'href="([^"]*\.pdf)"' -AllMatches

# Find budget-specific PDFs
Select-String -Path site_source.html -Pattern 'href="([^"]*[Bb]udget[^"]*\.pdf)"'
```

### Step 5: Direct Download (NOT Browser)
```powershell
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "$PDF_URL" -OutFile "document.pdf" -UseBasicParsing
```

**SUCKLESS PRINCIPLE**: Minimum complexity, maximum effect
- curl/Invoke-WebRequest BEFORE headless browser
- Predict URLs from stack knowledge
- Fail fast, try next pattern

**Priority**: Direct URL > API > POST request > Browser automation (LAST RESORT)

See: `agent-services/templates/AGENT_INSTRUCTIONS_USER_REQUIRES_YOU_TO_READ_ALL_OF.TECH_STACK_RECON.template.md`

---
Workspace: Cursor_working_directory_misc
Updated: 2025-12-13

codeBlocks.content:
# start-llm.ps1 - Launch local LLM server for Cursor
# RTX 4060 8GB optimized settings

$ErrorActionPreference = "Stop"
Set-Location $PSScriptRoot

$model = "qwen2.5-coder-7b-instruct-q4_k_m.gguf"

if (-not (Test-Path $model)) {
    Write-Host "ERROR: Model not found: $model" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "Download from: https://huggingface.co/Qwen/Qwen2.5-Coder-7B-Instruct-GGUF"
    exit 1
}

Write-Host "Starting llamafile server..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Model: $model"
Write-Host "Endpoint: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1"
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Press Ctrl+C to stop"
Write-Host ""

# RTX 4060 8GB settings:
# -ngl 99       = Offload all layers to GPU (7B Q4 fits in 8GB with room to spare)

codeBlocks.content:
# AGENT ONBOARDING - READ FIRST

**STOP. Before generating any code, read this file completely.**

This workspace uses pre-built helper scripts and templates to minimize token consumption and maximize code quality. Do NOT generate multi-step shell/git commands manually. Use the scripts below.

---

## Critical Rules

1. **No emojis** in source code, configs, or documentation
2. **Default languages**: PowerShell (Windows), POSIX sh (Unix), C17, AMD64/ARM64 assembly
3. **Universal config paradigm**: One `.cfg` file consumed by three scripts (POSIX sh, PowerShell v5, PowerShell v7)
4. **Use existing scripts** instead of generating equivalent commands
5. **BSD-2-Clause** license with DCO sign-off required
6. **Check BROKEN_SCRIPTS.md** for scripts that need verification before use

---

## CRITICAL: NEVER DELEGATE WORK TO THE USER

**THIS IS NON-NEGOTIABLE. READ CAREFULLY.**

Agents exist to DO THE WORK. The user is NOT your assistant. You are THEIR assistant.

- NEVER ask the user to run commands for you
- NEVER ask the user to copy-paste output
- NEVER ask the user to check something manually
- NEVER say "please run this in your terminal"
- USE the native shell tool directly (shell bug resolved 2025-12-14)

If you cannot complete a task, explain WHY and propose an AUTOMATED solution. Do NOT make the user do your job.

---

## GENERAL Scripts, SPECIFIC Tasks

**CRITICAL CONCEPT:** The scripts in this workspace are GENERAL-PURPOSE building blocks, NOT task-specific solutions.

Agents must understand:

1. **Scripts are composable** - Combine multiple general scripts to accomplish specific tasks
2. **Templates are parameterized** - One template serves many use cases via `.cfg` substitution
3. **No script-per-task assumption** - Do NOT expect `do-exactly-what-I-need.ps1` to exist
4. **Adapt and compose** - Use existing scripts creatively; extend only when necessary

**Example - Creating a New C Project:**
```powershell
# WRONG: Looking for "New-CProject.ps1"
# RIGHT: Compose general tools
.\New-Project-v7.ps1 -ConfigFile project.cfg  # General scaffolding
.\Invoke-Template.ps1 -Language c             # Language-specific templates
.\git-ops\New-Repo.ps1 -WithBackup            # Git setup
```

---

## Fravia Search Strategy + Suckless Principles

Apply reverse-engineering search methodology with minimal-complexity execution.

### Fravia Method: Search Strategy Formulation

Before searching, PLAN the search:

1. **Define the target** - What exactly are you looking for? (file, function, pattern, concept)
2. **Predict locations** - Where would this logically exist? (directory, file type, naming convention)
3. **Choose search depth** - Broad reconnaissance first, then targeted drilling
4. **Formulate patterns** - Build regex from known fragments, not guesses
5. **Cross-reference results** - Validate findings against multiple indicators

### Suckless Principles: Minimal Complexity, Maximum Effect

**AVOID** these anti-patterns (Useless Use of Cat and friends):

```sh
# BAD: UUoC - Useless Use of Cat
cat file.txt | grep pattern
cat file.txt | wc -l
cat file.txt | awk '{print $1}'
cat file.txt | sed 's/foo/bar/'

# GOOD: Direct invocation
grep pattern file.txt
wc -l < file.txt
awk '{print $1}' file.txt
sed 's/foo/bar/' file.txt
```

**AVOID** unnecessary tool chains:

```sh
# BAD: Multi-tool chain for simple task
cat file | grep foo | sed 's/bar/baz/' | awk '{print $2}' | wc -l

# GOOD: Single tool when possible
awk '/foo/ { gsub(/bar/, "baz"); print $2; count++ } END { print count }' file
```

**PREFER** heredoc and ed/vi for edits:

```sh
# BAD: Multiple sed invocations
sed -i 's/old1/new1/' file
sed -i 's/old2/new2/' file
sed -i 's/old3/new3/' file

# GOOD: Single heredoc with ed
ed -s file <<'EOF'
%s/old1/new1/g
%s/old2/new2/g
%s/old3/new3/g
w
q
EOF

# GOOD: Single sed with multiple expressions
sed -i -e 's/old1/new1/g' -e 's/old2/new2/g' -e 's/old3/new3/g' file
```

### Search Tool Priority

Use tools in this order (most efficient first):

| Priority | Tool | Use Case |
|----------|------|----------|
| 1 | `grep -r` / `rg` | Known pattern, broad search |
| 2 | `find` + `-name` | Known filename pattern |
| 3 | `git grep` | Within git repo, respects .gitignore |
| 4 | Codebase semantic search | Concept/meaning-based queries |
| 5 | Web search | External documentation, APIs |

### PowerShell Equivalents

```powershell
# BAD: Pipeline abuse
Get-Content file.txt | Select-String pattern
Get-Content file.txt | Measure-Object -Line
Get-Content file.txt | ForEach-Object { $_.Split()[0] }

# GOOD: Direct parameter usage
Select-String -Path file.txt -Pattern pattern
(Get-Content file.txt).Count
(Get-Content file.txt) -replace 'pattern', 'replacement'

# GOOD: Single expression for complex operations
Get-Content file.txt | ForEach-Object -Begin { $count = 0 } -Process {
    if ($_ -match 'pattern') { $count++ }
} -End { $count }
```

### The Suckless Test

Before executing a command chain, ask:

1. Can this be done with ONE tool instead of many?
2. Am I piping cat/Get-Content unnecessarily?
3. Would a heredoc/here-string be cleaner?
4. Is there a built-in flag that eliminates a pipeline stage?
5. Am I using awk/sed when grep alone suffices (or vice versa)?

**Rule of thumb:** If your command has more than 2 pipes, reconsider the approach.

---

## RESOLVED: Agent Shell Bug Workaround (Windows 11)

**Status:** RESOLVED as of 2025-12-14. Shell tool now works correctly.

**History:** Between 2025-12-07 and 2025-12-14, Cursor Shell tool returned `pid: -1` on Windows 11 (build 26200, Cursor 2.1.50+). This has been fixed.

### File-Based Shell Bridge (Archived - For Reference Only)

The bridge workaround below is no longer needed but preserved for reference if the issue recurs.

<details>
<summary>Click to expand archived workaround</summary>

When the Cursor Shell tool fails, use `agent-shell-bridge.ps1` which runs in the user's manual terminal.

**To execute shell commands:**

1. Write command to `.agent-command.txt` using the Write tool
2. Wait briefly, then read `.agent-status.txt` (should say `DONE`)
3. Read result from `.agent-result.txt`

**Example:**

```
# Step 1: Write command
Write tool -> .agent-command.txt -> "hostname; Get-Date"

# Step 2: Check status
Read tool -> .agent-status.txt -> "DONE"

# Step 3: Read result
Read tool -> .agent-result.txt -> "EXIT_CODE=0\nDESKTOP-7KTB236\n..."
```

**Files:**

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `.agent-command.txt` | Write your command here (bridge consumes it) |
| `.agent-status.txt` | READY/RUNNING/DONE |
| `.agent-result.txt` | EXIT_CODE=N followed by output |
| `agent-shell-bridge.ps1` | The bridge script (user starts once) |

</details>

---

---

## Known Issues: BROKEN_SCRIPTS.md

Before using or modifying scripts, check `BROKEN_SCRIPTS.md` for:

- Scripts that silently skip critical functionality
- Useless Use of Cat (UUoC) patterns in shell scripts
- Placeholder values that should be complete functions
- Templates with unsubstituted variables
- Scripts requiring verification

**When a script fails during agent operations:**
1. Do NOT attempt to fix inline
2. Add to `BROKEN_SCRIPTS.md` with filename, filepath, and issue description
3. Mark as unchecked `[ ]`
4. Only check off `[x]` when fully verified working

---

## Helper Script Index (General-Purpose Building Blocks)

**These are GENERAL scripts.** Combine them to accomplish SPECIFIC tasks. Do not expect a dedicated script for every operation.

All scripts are in `github-backup/cursor-project-scaffolding-backup/ludoplex-cursor-project-scaffolding-backup-*/`

### Project Scaffolding (General)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Create new project | `new-project.sh` / `New-Project-v5.ps1` / `New-Project-v7.ps1` | `project.cfg` |
| Watch/backup files | `watch-project.sh` / `Watch-Project-v5.ps1` / `Watch-Project-v7.ps1` | `watcher.cfg` |
| Process templates | `Invoke-Template.ps1` | (inline params) |

### Git Operations (git-ops/) - General

| Task | Script |
|------|--------|
| Create GitHub repo | `New-Repo.ps1` / `new-repo.sh` |
| Clone with backup | `Import-Repo.ps1` / `import-repo.sh` (legacy) |

### Import Repository (github-backup/) - General, with gh fallback

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Import repo | `import-repo.sh` / `Import-Repo-v5.ps1` / `Import-Repo-v7.ps1` | `import-repo.cfg` |

Tries git clone first, falls back to gh api zip download when git fails.
| Create branch | `New-Branch.ps1` / `new-branch.sh` |
| Archive project | `Archive-Repo.ps1` / `archive-repo.sh` |
| Sync backups | `Sync-Backup.ps1` / `sync-backup.sh` |
| Update index | `Update-RepoIndex.ps1` / `update-index.sh` |

### Utilities (utils/) - General Search/Reconnaissance

| Task | Script |
|------|--------|
| Project tree | `Get-ProjectStructure.ps1` |
| Find files | `Search-Files.ps1` / `search-files.sh` |
| Search content | `Search-Content.ps1` / `search-content.sh` |

**Note:** These wrap grep/find with sensible defaults. Use directly when wrappers add overhead.

### Production Readiness (prr/)

| Task | Script |
|------|--------|
| Run PRR checks | `Invoke-PRR.ps1` / `prr-check.sh` |

### Network Diagnostics (templates/network/)

| Task | Script (Windows) | Script (POSIX) | Config |
|------|------------------|----------------|--------|
| Port scanning | `Invoke-NetworkScan-v7.ps1` | `network-scan.sh` | `network.cfg` |
| DNS diagnostics | `Invoke-DnsDiagnostics-v7.ps1` | `dns-diagnostics.sh` | `network.cfg` |
| Network forensics | `Invoke-NetworkForensics-v7.ps1` | `network-forensics.sh` | `network.cfg` |
| Packet capture | `Invoke-PacketCapture-v7.ps1` (pktmon) | `packet-capture.sh` (tcpdump) | `network.cfg` |
| Background wrapper | `Invoke-BackgroundDiagnostics-v7.ps1` | (use nohup/&) | `network.cfg` |

Detects: DNS hijacking, ARP spoofing, LLMNR poisoning, suspicious connections, firewall issues.

### Linting (workspace root)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Aggregate linting | `lint-project.sh` / `Lint-Project-v5.ps1` / `Lint-Project-v7.ps1` | `lint.cfg` |

Runs C, Shell, PowerShell, JSON, YAML, Markdown linters plus ROSE-style policy checks:
- No tab characters in source files
- Maximum line length (default 132)
- Unix line endings (LF not CRLF)
- No "using" directives in headers

### Nuclei Vulnerability Scanning (nuclei-ops/)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Run nuclei scan | `nuclei-scan.sh` / `Invoke-NucleiScan-v5.ps1` / `Invoke-NucleiScan-v7.ps1` | `nuclei-scan.cfg` |

Features: Unified config for target, templates, rate limiting, output format. Auto-detects nuclei binary.

### Cursor Backup Extension (cursor-backup-ops/)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Install extension | `install-backup-extension.sh` / `Install-BackupExtension-v5.ps1` / `Install-BackupExtension-v7.ps1` | `backup-extension.cfg` |

Features: Builds TypeScript, packages VSIX, auto-detects IDE (Cursor/VS Code/Codium).

### Portmaster DNS Firewall (portmaster-ops/)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Status check | `portmaster-status.sh` / `Get-PortmasterStatus-v5.ps1` / `Get-PortmasterStatus-v7.ps1` | `portmaster.cfg` |
| Full diagnostics | `Invoke-PortmasterDiagnostics-v7.ps1` | `portmaster.cfg` |

### WSL2 KVM for Docker-OSX (wsl-kvm-ops/)

| Task | Script | Config |
|------|--------|--------|
| Enable features | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step Features` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |
| Install distro | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step Distro` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |
| Build KVM kernel | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step Kernel` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |
| Configure WSL | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step Configure` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |
| Setup Docker-OSX | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step DockerOsx` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |
| Check status | `Install-WslKvm-v5.ps1 -Step Status` | `wsl-kvm.cfg` |

Workflow: Features (reboot) -> Distro -> Kernel -> Configure -> DockerOsx

Features:
- Detects if Portmaster is sole DNS resolver (`noAssignedNameservers: true`)
- Tests DoT (DNS-over-TLS) server connectivity
- Compares DNS resolution through Portmaster vs external servers
- Analyzes logs for blocked connections and resolver failures
- Identifies common DNS error patterns (0.0.0.17, .lan suffix, no compliant resolvers)

Key Portmaster paths:
- Config: `C:\ProgramData\Portmaster\config.json`
- Logs: `C:\ProgramData\Portmaster\logs\`
- UI: `http://127.0.0.1:817`

---

## Token Savings Example

**WITHOUT scripts** (agent generates each command):
```powershell
gh repo create owner/name --private
gh repo create owner/name-backup --private
cd /path/to/project
git init
git remote add origin https://github.com/owner/name.git
git remote add backup https://github.com/owner/name-backup.git
git add -A
git commit -s -m "Initial commit"
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
git push backup main
```
**Tokens: ~800-1200**

**WITH scripts** (single invocation):
```powershell
.\git-ops\New-Repo.ps1 -Path "." -Private -WithBackup
```
**Tokens: ~50** (94% savings)

---

## Agent Instruction Files

Project-specific agent instructions are in `.copilot/` directories:

| Agent | Purpose | File |
|-------|---------|------|
| checks-agent | CI/CD monitoring | `checks-agent-instructions.md` |
| code-maintainer | C/ASM code quality | `code-maintainer-instructions.md` |
| database-maintainer | SQLite schema/migrations | `database-maintainer-instructions.md` |
| docs-maintainer | Documentation quality | `docs-maintainer-instructions.md` |
| github-actions-agent | Workflow management | `github-actions-agent-instructions.md` |
| prd-agent | Requirements alignment | `prd-agent-instructions.md` |
| test-runner | Test execution | `test-runner-instructions.md` |
| validator | Script/config validation | `validator-instructions.md` |
| workflow-maintainer | CI/CD configuration | `workflow-maintainer-instructions.md` |

---

## Template System

Templates in `templates/` use `{{VARIABLE}}` substitution:

- `templates/base/` - Common files (LICENSE, README, CONTRIBUTING)
- `templates/languages/` - Language-specific (c, python, rust, go, sh, powershell)
- `templates/ci-cd/` - CI/CD workflows (github-actions)
- `templates/platforms/` - Platform-specific

Invoke with:
```powershell
.\Invoke-Template.ps1 -ConfigFile project.cfg -Language c -OutputPath ./my-project
```

---

## Platform Detection

Scripts auto-detect platform and set defaults:

| Platform | Shell | Language | Assembly |
|----------|-------|----------|----------|
| Windows x64 | PowerShell | C17 | MASM/AMD64 |
| Windows ARM64 | PowerShell | C17 | ARM64 |
| macOS x64 | sh | C17 | AMD64 |
| macOS ARM64 | sh | C17 | A64 |
| Linux x64 | sh | C17 | AMD64 |
| Linux ARM64 | sh | C17 | A64 |

---

## Before Generating Code

1. Check if a helper script exists for the task
2. Use `Search-Files.ps1` to find relevant templates
3. Use `Get-ProjectStructure.ps1` to understand layout
4. Read relevant `.copilot/*-instructions.md` files
5. Follow PRR guidelines for production readiness

---

## Background Execution for Long-Running Processes

When running scripts that have no definite end time (diagnostics, watchers, packet captures, servers), use background execution to avoid blocking the agent session.

### Problem

Agent tool calls timeout when scripts run too long. Scripts that:
- Collect data over extended periods (packet capture, forensics)
- Watch for file changes indefinitely
- Wait for network events
- Run servers or daemons

will cause `Tool call errored or timed out` errors.

### Solution: Background Wrapper Pattern

**Windows (PowerShell 7+):**
```powershell
# Use the background diagnostics wrapper
.\templates\network\Invoke-BackgroundDiagnostics-v7.ps1 -Script NetworkForensics -OutputPath .\results

# Or run any script in background with output capture
$job = Start-Job -ScriptBlock { & .\SomeLongScript.ps1 *>&1 | Tee-Object -FilePath .\output.txt }

# Check status later
Get-Content .\diagnostics-output\*-status.json
Get-Content .\diagnostics-output\*-stdout.txt
```

**Unix (POSIX sh):**
```sh
# Run with nohup and redirect output
nohup ./network-forensics.sh -o ./results > ./forensics.log 2>&1 &
echo $! > ./forensics.pid

# Check status later
cat ./forensics.log
kill -0 $(cat ./forensics.pid) && echo "Still running" || echo "Completed"
```

### Background Wrapper Scripts

| Task | Script | Output |
|------|--------|--------|
| Network diagnostics | `Invoke-BackgroundDiagnostics-v7.ps1` | `*-status.json`, `*-stdout.txt` |
| File watcher | `Watch-Project-v7.ps1` (run with Start-Job) | watcher.log |
| Packet capture | `Invoke-PacketCapture-v7.ps1` | ETL/PCAP files |

### Agent Workflow for Background Tasks

1. **Start**: Launch script with background wrapper, capture job/PID
2. **Continue**: Proceed with other tasks while script runs
3. **Check**: Read status file or stdout file to get results
4. **Retrieve**: Parse JSON output files for programmatic access

### Example: Network Diagnostics

```powershell
# Start forensics in background (returns immediately)
.\templates\network\Invoke-BackgroundDiagnostics-v7.ps1 -Script NetworkForensics -OutputPath .\forensics-results

# Do other work...

# Later, check results
Get-Content .\forensics-results\*-status.json | ConvertFrom-Json
Get-Content .\forensics-results\*-stdout.txt
Get-Content .\forensics-results\summary.json | ConvertFrom-Json
```

### Key Files After Background Execution

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `*-status.json` | Job state: Running/Completed/Failed, timestamps, exit code |
| `*-stdout.txt` | Captured console output |
| `*-stderr.txt` | Error output (if any) |
| `summary.json` | Structured results from the diagnostic script |

### Critical Rule

**DO NOT** run these scripts directly via `run_terminal_cmd` without background:
- `Invoke-NetworkForensics-v7.ps1`
- `Invoke-PacketCapture-v7.ps1`
- `Watch-Project-*.ps1`
- Any script with indefinite runtime

**DO** use `Invoke-BackgroundDiagnostics-v7.ps1` or `Start-Job` wrapper, then read output files.

---

## Config File Format

Universal `.cfg` files use `KEY=VALUE` format:

```
# Comment lines start with #
PROJECT_NAME=MyApp
TYPE=cli
LANGUAGE=c
AUTHOR=username
LICENSE=BSD-2-Clause
BACKUP_ENABLED=true
```

Parsed identically by all three script consumers.

---

## Validation Before Commit

Run these before declaring work complete:

```powershell
# Aggregate linting (uses lint.cfg)
.\Lint-Project-v7.ps1       # PowerShell 7+ (Windows/macOS/Linux)
.\Lint-Project-v5.ps1       # PowerShell 5.1 (Windows 10)
./lint-project.sh           # POSIX shell (macOS/Linux)
```

```sh
# Project-specific validation
./scripts/workflows.sh      # Validate GitHub Actions
./scripts/actions.sh        # Check action versions
./scripts/json-configs.sh   # Validate JSON files
./scripts/run-core-tests.sh # Run unit tests
```

---

## ROSE Policy Checkers

Integrated from `rose-1/scripts/policies/` (configure via `lint.cfg`):

| Config Key | Check |
|-----------|-------|
| `ROSE_NO_TABS` | No tab characters in source |
| `ROSE_MAX_LINE_LENGTH` | Lines <= N chars (default 132) |
| `ROSE_UNIX_LINE_ENDINGS` | LF only, no CRLF |
| `ROSE_NO_USING_IN_HEADERS` | No `using` directives in headers |
| `ROSE_CASE_INSENSITIVE_NAMES` | No files differing only by case |
| `ROSE_UNIQUE_HEADER_NAMES` | No duplicate header names |

Set `ROSE_SOURCE_EXTENSIONS` to control which files are checked.

---

## Required Reading for New Sessions

1. This file (`AGENT_ONBOARD.md`)
2. Project's `.cursorrules` if present
3. Project's `.copilot/` agent instructions if present
4. `git-ops/agent-instructions.md` for Git operations
5. `prr/agent-instructions-cursor.md` for production readiness

---

**DO NOT:**
- Generate multi-command sequences when a single script exists
- Assume a task-specific script exists for every operation
- Use cat/Get-Content in pipelines when direct tool invocation works
- Chain awk/sed/wc when a single tool with flags suffices
- Ask the user to run commands or copy-paste output

**DO:**
- Compose GENERAL scripts to accomplish SPECIFIC tasks
- Apply Fravia search strategy before grepping blindly
- Use suckless principles: minimum complexity, maximum effect
- Prefer heredoc/ed for multi-line edits over repeated sed calls
- Invoke scripts with appropriate parameters; extend only when necessary

---
